At the organization meeting held
last Friday afternoon in the gym, it
was decided that a tournament will
be run this year in the same fashion
as was used last year.
The tournament will begin about
the middle of November and will
come to a finish before Christmas.
The general rules will be the same
as last year but those four men—
Kramer, Hernandez, Glantz and Pasternak—who won medals last year
will be barred from the play. Medals will be awarded to the winners
and same will be assured of varsity
berths on the Johns Hopkins handball team.

all candidates at four o'clock at the
lower field. The Frosh and Soph
Box Lacrosse Leagues will begin
early this week. Junior and senior
clubs will be formed shortly.

Frosh Booters Begin
The Freshman Soccer Team of
the Johns Hopkins University is
scheduled to play its first match
of the season against Kenwood
High School Soccer Team, tomorrow at 4 p. m. at Homewood.
All freshmen are urged to come
out for the team. No experience is
,necessary and since a full freshman team has not as yet been selected, there are possibilities for
all men.
newcomers show great promise.
All those who signed up for handball will be given a key which opens
the handball box in the gym. The
box contains handball equipment and
will remain in the gym constantly so
that enthusiasts will always be able
to play..
All graduate students, faculty
members and others, who haven't as
yet signed up and who are interested
in playing handball are requested to
contact Dick Pasternak, Postoffice
box 781, at once, so that they will
be sure of securing a key to the
handball supplies.

Intercollegiate Interest Increases
Reuben Baer has done a great deal
to increase the interest at the Hopkins and also has stirred up interest
at other schools to the extent that
there will be sufficient intercollegiate
competition for the sports. Western
Maryland, Virginia, and St. John's
were able to play against the Hopkins last year and several other colleges are expected to form teams
again this year.

Lotz To instruct
Blue Jay Pugilists
Activity To Get Under Way
Early In November; Class
Tourney To Be Arranged
Boxing instfuction will be given
for the second consecutive year under the prophetic eye of Ed Lotz. It
is intended that the first drills will
be held late in November.
The purpose of the class will not
be to develop a team for collegiate
competition but rather to inform men
in the manly art of self defense and
at the same time help in their physical development.
It is proposed that an interclass
tournament will be held at the end of
the boxing season for those men who
have proved their boxing ability to
the satisfaction of the coach.
Men will be selected to participate
in the activities of the annual gymboree.
Equipment Available
Although the season will not begin until the latter part of November, equipment in the form of gloves,
heavy and light punching bags, may
be put to usa by those men who wish
to get an early start. All the equipment is located in the gymnasium.

Coach Ed Lotz is well qualified for
the role of boxing master, having

At the organization meeting held
last Friday afternoon in the gym, it
was decided that a tournament will
be run this year in the same fashion
as was used last year.
The tournament will begin about
the middle of November and will
come to a finish before Christmas.
The general rules will be the same
as last year but those four men—
Kramer, Hernandez, Glantz and Pasternak—who won medals last year
will be barred from the play. Medals will be awarded to the winners
and same will be assured of varsity
berths on the Johns Hopkins handball team.

early this week. Junior and senior

Frosh Booters Begin
The Freshman Soccer Team of
the Johns Hopkins University is
scheduled to play its first match
of the season against Kenwood
High School Soccer Team, tomorrow at 4 p. m. at Homewood.
All freshmen are urged to come
out for the team. No experience is
,necessary and since a full freshman team has not as yet been selected, there are possibilities for
all men.
newcomers show great promise.
All those who signed up for handball will be given a key which opens
the handball box in the gym. The
box contains handball equipment and
will remain in the gym constantly so
that enthusiasts will always be able
to play..
All graduate students, faculty
members and others, who haven't as
yet signed up and who are interested
in playing handball are requested to
contact Dick Pasternak, Postoffice
box 781, at once, so that they will
be sure of securing a key to the
handball supplies.

Intercollegiate Interest Increases
Reuben Baer has done a great deal
to increase the interest at the Hopkins and also has stirred up interest
at other schools to the extent that
there will be sufficient intercollegiate
competition for the sports. Western
Maryland, Virginia, and St. John's
were able to play against the Hopkins last year and several other colleges are expected to form teams
again this year.

Lotz To instruct
Blue Jay Pugilists
Activity To Get Under Way
Early In November; Class
Tourney To Be Arranged
Boxing instfuction will be given
for the second consecutive year under the prophetic eye of Ed Lotz. It
is intended that the first drills will
be held late in November.
The purpose of the class will not
be to develop a team for collegiate
competition but rather to inform men
in the manly art of self defense and
at the same time help in their physical development.
It is proposed that an interclass
tournament will be held at the end of
the boxing season for those men who
have proved their boxing ability to
the satisfaction of the coach.
Men will be selected to participate
in the activities of the annual gymboree.
Equipment Available
Although the season will not begin until the latter part of November, equipment in the form of gloves,
heavy and light punching bags, may
be put to usa by those men who wish
to get an early start. All the equipment is located in the gymnasium.

the role of boxing master, having
